page.title: 14LAW AND ORDER
page.content: Birtley is policed by three community policemen and two C.I.D. officers. The police prefer to walk their beat as they feel this gives them the opportunity to keep in close contact with the residents of Birtley. Serious crime is rare in the area although incidents of criminal damage are high as are house and shop breaking. Most offenders are teenage boys. Glue sniffing is also a problem but by visiting schools and youth centres the police hope to lessen these problems. Six or seven incidents are reported daily to Gateshead headquarters and these are passed to local police. Most people appear to be very satisfied with the way Birtley is policed.
